004
005package edu.wpi.first.util;
006
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
009import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
010
011/** WPIUtil JNI. */
012public class WPIUtilJNI {
013  static boolean libraryLoaded = false;
014
015  /** Sets whether JNI should be loaded in the static block. */
016  public static class Helper {
017    private static AtomicBoolean extractOnStaticLoad = new AtomicBoolean(true);
018
019    /**
020     * Returns true if the JNI should be loaded in the static block.
021     *
022     * @return True if the JNI should be loaded in the static block.
023     */
024    public static boolean getExtractOnStaticLoad() {
025      return extractOnStaticLoad.get();
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * Sets whether the JNI should be loaded in the static block.
030     *
031     * @param load Whether the JNI should be loaded in the static block.
032     */
033    public static void setExtractOnStaticLoad(boolean load) {
034      extractOnStaticLoad.set(load);
035    }
036
037    /** Utility class. */
038    private Helper() {}
039  }
040
041  static {
042    if (Helper.getExtractOnStaticLoad()) {
043      try {
044        RuntimeLoader.loadLibrary("wpiutiljni");
045      } catch (Exception ex) {
046        ex.printStackTrace();
047        System.exit(1);
048      }
049      libraryLoaded = true;
050    }
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Force load the library.
055   *
056   * @throws IOException if the library failed to load
057   */
058  public static synchronized void forceLoad() throws IOException {
059    if (libraryLoaded) {
060      return;
061    }
062    RuntimeLoader.loadLibrary("wpiutiljni");
063    libraryLoaded = true;
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Write the given string to stderr.
068   *
069   * @param str String to write.
070   */
071  public static native void writeStderr(String str);
072
073  /** Enable mock time. */
074  public static native void enableMockTime();
075
076  /** Disable mock time. */
077  public static native void disableMockTime();
078
079  /**
080   * Set mock time.
081   *
082   * @param time The desired time in microseconds.
083   */
084  public static native void setMockTime(long time);
085
086  /**
087   * Returns the time.
088   *
089   * @return The time.
090   */
091  public static native long now();
092
093  /**
094   * Returns the system time.
095   *
096   * @return The system time.
097   */
098  public static native long getSystemTime();
099
100  /**
101   * Creates an event. Events have binary state (signaled or not signaled) and may be either
102   * automatically reset or manually reset. Automatic-reset events go to non-signaled state when a
103   * WaitForObject is woken up by the event; manual-reset events require ResetEvent() to be called
104   * to set the event to non-signaled state; if ResetEvent() is not called, any waiter on that event
105   * will immediately wake when called.
106   *
107   * @param manualReset true for manual reset, false for automatic reset
108   * @param initialState true to make the event initially in signaled state
109   * @return Event handle
110   */
111  public static native int createEvent(boolean manualReset, boolean initialState);
112
113  /**
114   * Destroys an event. Destruction wakes up any waiters.
115   *
116   * @param eventHandle event handle
117   */
118  public static native void destroyEvent(int eventHandle);
119
120  /**
121   * Sets an event to signaled state.
122   *
123   * @param eventHandle event handle
124   */
125  public static native void setEvent(int eventHandle);
126
127  /**
128   * Sets an event to non-signaled state.
129   *
130   * @param eventHandle event handle
131   */
132  public static native void resetEvent(int eventHandle);
133
134  /**
135   * Creates a semaphore. Semaphores keep an internal counter. Releasing the semaphore increases the
136   * count. A semaphore with a non-zero count is considered signaled. When a waiter wakes up it
137   * atomically decrements the count by 1. This is generally useful in a single-supplier,
138   * multiple-consumer scenario.
139   *
140   * @param initialCount initial value for the semaphore's internal counter
141   * @param maximumCount maximum value for the semaphore's internal counter
142   * @return Semaphore handle
143   */
144  public static native int createSemaphore(int initialCount, int maximumCount);
145
146  /**
147   * Destroys a semaphore. Destruction wakes up any waiters.
148   *
149   * @param semHandle semaphore handle
150   */
151  public static native void destroySemaphore(int semHandle);
152
153  /**
154   * Releases N counts of a semaphore.
155   *
156   * @param semHandle semaphore handle
157   * @param releaseCount amount to add to semaphore's internal counter; must be positive
158   * @return True on successful release, false on failure (e.g. release count would exceed maximum
159   *     value, or handle invalid)
160   */
161  public static native boolean releaseSemaphore(int semHandle, int releaseCount);
162
163  static native long allocateRawFrame();
164
165  static native void freeRawFrame(long frame);
166
167  static native long getRawFrameDataPtr(long frame);
168
169  static native void setRawFrameData(
170      long frame, ByteBuffer data, int size, int width, int height, int stride, int pixelFormat);
171
172  static native void setRawFrameInfo(
173      long frame, int size, int width, int height, int stride, int pixelFormat);
174
175  /**
176   * Waits for a handle to be signaled.
177   *
178   * @param handle handle to wait on
179   * @throws InterruptedException on failure (e.g. object was destroyed)
180   */
181  public static native void waitForObject(int handle) throws InterruptedException;
182
183  /**
184   * Waits for a handle to be signaled, with timeout.
185   *
186   * @param handle handle to wait on
187   * @param timeout timeout in seconds
188   * @return True if timeout reached without handle being signaled
189   * @throws InterruptedException on failure (e.g. object was destroyed)
190   */
191  public static native boolean waitForObjectTimeout(int handle, double timeout)
192      throws InterruptedException;
193
194  /**
195   * Waits for one or more handles to be signaled.
196   *
197   * <p>Invalid handles are treated as signaled; the returned array will have the handle error bit
198   * set for any invalid handles.
199   *
200   * @param handles array of handles to wait on
201   * @return array of signaled handles
202   * @throws InterruptedException on failure (e.g. no objects were signaled)
203   */
204  public static native int[] waitForObjects(int[] handles) throws InterruptedException;
205
206  /**
207   * Waits for one or more handles to be signaled, with timeout.
208   *
209   * <p>Invalid handles are treated as signaled; the returned array will have the handle error bit
210   * set for any invalid handles.
211   *
212   * @param handles array of handles to wait on
213   * @param timeout timeout in seconds
214   * @return array of signaled handles; empty if timeout reached without any handle being signaled
215   * @throws InterruptedException on failure (e.g. no objects were signaled and no timeout)
216   */
217  public static native int[] waitForObjectsTimeout(int[] handles, double timeout)
218      throws InterruptedException;
219
220  /**
221   * Create a native FileLogger. When the specified file is modified, appended data will be appended
222   * to the specified data log.
223   *
224   * @param file path to the file
225   * @param log data log implementation handle
226   * @param key log key to append data to
227   * @return The FileLogger handle.
228   */
229  public static native long createFileLogger(String file, long log, String key);
230
231  /**
232   * Free a native FileLogger. This causes the FileLogger to stop appending data to the log.
233   *
234   * @param fileTail The FileLogger handle.
235   */
236  public static native void freeFileLogger(long fileTail);
237
238  /** Utility class. */
239  protected WPIUtilJNI() {}
240}
